name: places/ChIJ3X1HjBtZwokRasVQSCwBSn0
adrFormatAddress: 853 11th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: I had been enjoying this office until I arrived for a periodontist consultation appointment‚Äîan appointment I'd had for over a month. They chose to wait until then to tell me first that I "may" need some kind of special 3D scan that would cost $500 out of pocket since insurance doesn't cover it, later telling me I for sure had to do that‚Äîbefore the periodontist had even seen me. That last bit essentially confirms that this is an office focused on making money by charging for services regardless of whether or not they're even needed. Again, this person had not looked at my mouth at all and yet the front office had decided I needed a $500 service that can't be billed to insurance. Needless to say, I will be finding a new dentist.

originalText.text: Very modern and clean looking office. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Dr. Shanin delivered the best care I've ever experienced for both my mother and myself when we went to get our wisdom teeth taken out. Especially as my mother had a very poor extraction experience years prior and was surprised with how quick and easy this one went. I would recommend to anyone for an in and out pain free experience.

text.text: Very modern and clean looking office. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Dr. Shanin delivered the best care I've ever experienced for both my mother and myself when we went to get our wisdom teeth taken out. Especially as my mother had a very poor extraction experience years prior and was surprised with how quick and easy this one went. I would recommend to anyone for an in and out pain free experience.

originalText.text:
I regret that I haven't read reviews prior to my visits.

Quality of service was good, and both doctors and front desk were very friendly, but I faced issues with billing too.

I've got deep cleaning scheduled and right before the procedure I was told at the reception that I have to pay full cost since they did not get confirmation from my insurance yet. I was assured that the procedure here is that I have to submit a claim to my insurance directly. I am a refugee who just starts getting familiar with US healthcare and insurance system, so I trusted the word.

Therefore, as I couldn't have waited and delayed the procedure any longer, I paid $672 - which is huge for me, even assuming potential reimbursement through a claim. However, when I contacted my insurance trying to submit a claim, they mentioned that was a malpractice of the dental office and they never should have asked me to pay the full cost. Since the office is in network, it was their call to submit a claim, rather than charge me. And now I cannot submit that claim on my own, but have to request for a refund from the dental office while they submit a claim and get paid by the insurance.

I sent a request to the dental office, and not taking this review down until I get paid back.

originalText.text: Staff super friendly, space is beautiful - comfy waiting area in the reception with big plush couch and floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom is the size of a what could be considered a bedroom in NYC with plants and different soaps. Music was üî•üî•. Not your typical dentist office instrumental easy listening mix on repeat. All the people up in my mouth were so kind and took their time without seeming rushed. 10/10 would recommend to a friend, a spouse, a grandma, a side piece, everyone. üëèüëèüëè

originalText.text: Clean facility, great staff and wonderful pediatric dentist- Dr. Lisa is the best, she‚Äôs been seeing my daughters for years. She‚Äôs so gentle and calm, I want her as my dentist!
